FuncDef: The activate aaa local-user command unlocks the specified local user account.

ParaDef.Info:
A user name.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 case-insensitive characters without spaces.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a user account is locked because the number of successive authentication failure exceeds the upper limit set by the user-block failed-times command, the activate command can be used to unlock the user account.
When a user account is expired, the administrator can use the activate command to unlock the user account.
Precautions
After a local user is unlocked and the user name is used for login but the entered password is incorrect, the system still displays a message indicating that the user account is locked.
